string_data:
Looking at my previous output, I can see I made several mistakes in my tagging. Let me provide the corrected version:

ID: Daily-Mail_2023-12-11_Just-Stop-Oil
Source: Daily-Mail
Title: #DS Just Stop Oil activists who took part in slow march across Waterloo Bridge #DE are told by judge they can CONTINUE taking part in 'peaceful' protests before their 2025 trial
Content: #DS #PH #CS Just Stop Oil protesters on Waterloo Bridge in London on November 8 as they slow-march in the road (Alt: The image shows Just Stop Oil protesters conducting a slow march on Waterloo Bridge in London. Demonstrators wearing orange high-visibility vests hold orange ) #CE
Just Stop Oil activists who took part in a slow march across Waterloo Bridge #DE have been told by a judge that they can continue taking part in 'peaceful' protests before their 2025 trial.#DS Stephen Simpson, 70, Barbara Lund, 70, David Mitchell , 62, Patrick Walker, 34, Andrew Bellis, 44 and Peter Lillie, 31, joined the Just Stop Oil demo on November 8.They all denied an offence contrary to the Public Order Act 2023 at Southwark Crown Court today.According to the charge they 'interfered with the use or operation of a key national infrastructure in England and Wales, namely Waterloo Bridge, intending that act to interfere with the use or operation of such infrastructure or being reckless as to whether it would do so'.The six were told they will not stand trial until 2025. #DE Judge David Tomlinson said he was prepared to relax earlier bail conditions, preventing five of the six defendants from coming within the M25.He said the latest condition 'does not stop anyone from taking part in a peaceful protest.'#NS What it stops them from doing is participating in a procession which prevents members of the public from going about their lawful business. #DE
#DS #PH #CS Stephen Simpson, 70, Barbara Lund, 70, David Mitchell, 62, Patrick Walker, 34, Andrew Bellis, 44 and Peter Lillie, 31, were charged after the march (Alt: The image shows numerous police officers in high-visibility yellow jackets gathered on what appears to be Waterloo Bridge. Multiple police vehicles are visible, including marked patrol cars. Officers are clustered around what seems to be an arrest or detention situation involving protesters. The scene depicts a significant police response to what appears to be a protest action on the bridge.) #CE #DE
#NS 'We are talking about competing rights here and this condition does not stop them protesting, it does however stop them from preventing people from going about their lawful business.'This condition of bail is entirely proportionate to anyone who was given instruction by police.'It is proportionate to try and stop any of you being accused of any further offences between now and the trial date.' #NE #DS Simpson, of Belmont Cresent, Bradford, Lund, of Lyde Green Lane, Frome, Mitchell, of Cumberland Road, Bristol, Walker, of Harlequin Drive, Newport, Bellis, of Kinseys Lane, Cheshire and Lillie of Mendip Road, Bristol, all denied one count of interfering with the use of a key national infrastructure.They will return to court for further hearings on 19 January and 12 April 2024, but their trial is unlikely to be heard until 2025. #DE The condition does not apply to Simpson because he has been allowed unconditional bail throughout.
#MS #PH #CS Supporters of Just Stop Oil march across London behind a banner saying 'No Prison For Peaceful Protest' on December 2 after a growing number of activists are being held on remand in prison (Alt: The image shows a protest march in London with demonstrators carrying an orange banner reading ) #CE #ME
